subSections.title: Glyph origin
subSections.text:
{{Han etym}}
{{Han compound|彡|頁|ls=p|t1=hair|t2=head}} – a head with hair on its side – [[beard]]; [[whisker]]s — original character of {{och-l|鬚}}. Originally a single picture, but abstracted in the seal script into a compound.

subSections.title: Etymology 1
subSections.text:
; “to wait”
: {{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}}, reconstructing the Old Chinese as ''*sno'', suggests that it is probably a causative derivation from {{och-l|懦|id=2|weak; soft}}, literally “to make (time) pliant”.
